question.text: Which of the following is not correct about the alkaloid obtained from the Papaver somniferum plant?

options.text: These are opioids drugs, binds to specific opioid receptors present in our brain and gastrointestinal tract.
Heroin is chemically diacetylmorphine and is commonly called smack.
It is taken by snorting and injection.
It is a CNS stimulant which also causes hallucinations.

solution.text: Opioids are the drugs that bind to specific opioid receptors present in our brain and gastrointestinal tract. Heroin is chemically diacetylmorphine and is commonly called a smack. It is taken by snorting and injection. Opioids are not hallucination inducing agents.
